thread.title: Snider, Dwenger win, set up SAC showdown, highlights of top games
thread.title_full: Snider, Dwenger win, set up SAC showdown, highlights of top games

title: Snider, Dwenger win, set up SAC showdown, highlights of top games
text:
Snider, Dwenger win, set up SAC showdown, highlights of top games 
By Dean Pantazi -21Alive October 3, 2015 Updated Oct 3, 2015 at 12:00 AM EDT 
UNDATED (21 Alive) - Snider and Dwenger scored big wins Friday night to set up their showdown for the Summit Athletic Conference title next week, while Bellmont remained unbeaten in the Northeast 8 and Fairfield took command of the Northeast Corner Conference Big School Division. 
Blake Podschlne passed for 183 yards and two touchdowns while Amaun Clark, Jack Harris, and Peter Winklejohn all ran for scores in Dwenger's 44-14 whipping of Carroll. 
Digital Daily â€“ subscribe to our daily newsletter 
Ian Miller ran for a score and passed for another in relief of Aidan Smith for the Carroll touchdowns. 
Snider warmed up for the meeting with Dwenger with their 63-13 win at North Side, which was the score at the half, after which the two team played with a running clock. 
Isaac Stiebling threw for 244 yard and four touchdowns, two of them to Mack Hippenhammerm while Dominick Scott ran for 136 yards and three touchdowns for the Panthers. 
Bellmont remained unbeaten in the NE 8 with their 31-14 romp past New Haven, as Caleb Hankenson led the way with 178 rushing yards and two touchdowns, and Grant Gutierrez ran for one score and passed for another for the Braves. 
Nishawn Jones scored both New Haven touchdowns while running for 129 yards. 
Fairfield came from behind with 34 unanswered second hall points and downed Garrett 65-32, offsetting a 127 yard town touchdown performance by Garrett's Jaden Baker. 
Peterson Kerlegrand ran for 224 yards and four touchdowns and added a fifth score on a pass reception in Concordia's 49-20 win at Northrop. 
Austin Mack scored four times and Dashon Bussell snared two touchdown passes at Luers ran past South Side 52-12, 
Harrison Price threw two touchdown passes to Will Chrisman and ran for two more on the ground as DeKalb blanked Norwell 31-0. 
Hunter Bates, Andrew Hammond, and Bailey Hurst all ran for touchdowns as Adams Central remained unbeaten with as 21-0 win at Southern Wells. 
For highlights of these games and other click on the video icon.
